definitions.usage: 指通过满足特定标准或要求，使某人或某事有资格参与某活动、获得某地位或权利。通常用于描述考试、比赛、职位申请等场景。

examples.scene: 小明正在申请一家国际公司的市场经理职位。他需要通过一系列的面试和技能测试来证明自己适合这个岗位。
examples.chineseIdea: 小明希望通过展示自己的专业能力和经验，获得这个职位的资格。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: After passing the interviews and skill tests, Xiaoming was able to @ @ @.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: After passing the interviews and skill tests, Xiaoming was able to 「qualify for a position」.
examples.chineseTranslation: 在通过面试和技能测试后，小明得以「获得职位资格」。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：'He passed the test to get the job qualification.' 纠正：'He qualified for the position after passing the tests.'

examples.scene: 李华是一名大学生，正在准备参加全国英语演讲比赛。她需要通过初赛来进入决赛。
examples.chineseIdea: 李华希望通过初赛的出色表现，获得进入决赛的机会。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: By delivering an impressive speech in the preliminary round, Li Hua managed to @ @ @.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: By delivering an impressive speech in the preliminary round, Li Hua managed to 「qualify for a competition」.
examples.chineseTranslation: 通过在初赛中发表精彩的演讲，李华成功「获得比赛资格」。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：'She passed the preliminary to join the competition.' 纠正：'She qualified for the competition with her performance.'

definitions.usage: 指通过培训、考试或实践，正式获得某种专业资格或身份，如医生、律师等职业资格。

examples.scene: 张伟在医学院学习了六年，完成了所有课程和实习，现在准备参加国家执业医师考试。
examples.chineseIdea: 张伟希望通过考试，正式成为一名合格的医生。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: After years of study and passing the licensing exam, Zhang Wei finally @ @ @.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: After years of study and passing the licensing exam, Zhang Wei finally 「qualified as a doctor」.
examples.chineseTranslation: 经过多年学习并通过执业考试，张伟终于「取得了医生资格」。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：'He passed exam to be doctor.' 纠正：'He qualified as a doctor after passing the exam.'

examples.scene: 王芳是一名教育专业的毕业生，她完成了教师培训课程并通过了资格考试。
examples.chineseIdea: 王芳希望通过培训和考试，正式成为一名中学教师。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: With her training and certification, Wang Fang successfully @ @ @.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: With her training and certification, Wang Fang successfully 「qualified as a teacher」.
examples.chineseTranslation: 凭借她的培训和认证，王芳成功「取得了教师资格」。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：'She finished training to become teacher.' 纠正：'She qualified as a teacher after completing her training.'

definitions.usage: 指在表达中对某事物加以限制、说明或补充，通常用于书面或正式语境，常见于法律、学术或正式讨论中。

examples.scene: 在一场学术会议上，李教授发表了一项研究成果，但她需要补充说明研究的适用范围。
examples.chineseIdea: 李教授希望通过补充说明，让听众更清楚研究的局限性。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: To avoid misunderstanding, Professor Li had to @ @ @ with additional context.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: To avoid misunderstanding, Professor Li had to 「qualify a statement」 with additional context.
examples.chineseTranslation: 为了避免误解，李教授不得不通过额外背景「限定她的陈述」。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：'She explained her statement more.' 纠正：'She qualified her statement with additional context.'

examples.scene: 在一次商业谈判中，张先生提出了一项大胆的计划，但他需要澄清这个计划的条件。
examples.chineseIdea: 张先生希望通过补充条件，让对方明白计划的可行性。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: During the negotiation, Mr. Zhang needed to @ @ @ to clarify its conditions.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: During the negotiation, Mr. Zhang needed to 「qualify a claim」 to clarify its conditions.
examples.chineseTranslation: 在谈判中，张先生需要「限定他的主张」以澄清其条件。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：'He added conditions to his claim.' 纠正：'He qualified his claim by specifying its conditions.'
